Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.messages

Class OperationMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.messages.OperationMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transmittable, Named, AsString, Message, Triaged
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OperationLifecycleMessage, OperationStatusMessage
    public abstract class OperationMessage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Named, Message
    Base implementation of the Message interface. Represents a message destined for a Listener such as a Logger with arguments which can be interpolated if the message is formatted with formatted(MessageFormatter.Format). All OperationMessages have the attributes defined in Message.

    For messages that might be sent to frequently, maximumFrequency(Frequency) can be used to specify that the receiver only handle the message every so often. Logs support this feature, so it is possible to easily tag a message as something to only log once in a while.

    See Also:
    Message, Log, Listener, Frequency, Severity

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.Message

      • maximumFrequency

        public Frequency maximumFrequency()
        Specified by:
        maximumFrequency in interface Message
        Returns:
        The frequency with which this message should be logged or null if the message should always be logged.

        NOTE: Message identity is determined by looking at the unformatted message returned by message(). If message() does not return a constant string, a bounded map error may occur as the system attempts to track too many message frequencies.
